intro: Erigeron ibarii, commonly known as the Ibari fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its small, white to pale blue flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron ibarii is often found in open woodlands, grasslands, and along coastal areas.
